title: Double Flute Player and Reclining Nude

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of pen and black ink, with brush and gray wash and scraping, on cream wove paper.

medium_display: Pen and black ink, with brush and gray wash and scraping, on cream wove paper
inscriptions: Signed recto, lower right, in graphite: "Picasso" (underlined); inscribed lower right, in pen and black ink: "Paris 22 octobre XXXII"
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph R. Shapiro
publication_history:
Christian Zervos, Pablo Picasso, VIII (Paris, 1957), p. 21, no. 45 (ill.).

The Picasso Project, Picasso’s Paintings, Watercolors, Drawings, and Sculpture: A Comprehensive Illustrated Catalogue 1885–1973, Surrealism 1930–1936 (San Francisco, 1997), p. 143, no. 32–52 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Oslo, Kunstnernes Hus, "Picasso," November–December 1956, pp. 37 and 58, cat. 76 (ill.), as Deux Femmes.

Paris, Galerie Berggruen, "Picasso Drawings," 1957.

New York, Charles Slatkin Galleries, "The Many Sided Artist," February 15–March 31, 1961, cat. 76 (ill.).

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Picasso in Chicago," February 3–March 31, 1968, pp. 81 and 117, cat. 89 (ill.).

Chicago, The Museum of Contemporary Art, "Selections from the Joseph Randall Shapiro Collection," December 20, 1969–February 1, 1970, cat. 124.

Cambridge, Fogg Art Museum, Harvard University, "Master Drawings by Picasso," 1981, hors cat.; shown only at The Art Institute of Chicago, April 29–June 14, 1981.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "The Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Randall Shapiro Collection," February 23–April 14, 1985, pp. 96 and 112, cat. 135 (ill.).

The Art Institute of Chicago, "An Irrational Act: Gifts of Surrealist Works on Paper from the Collection of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Randall Shapiro," December 15, 1992-April 18, 1993, p. 14, fig. 18.

Art Institute of Chicago, "Picasso and Chicago", February 20-May 12, 2013, hors cat.
provenance_text: Galerie Berggruen, Paris, by November 1956 [Oslo 1956].  Charles Slatkin Galleries, New York, by 1961 [New York 1961].  Mr. and Mrs. Joseph R. Shapiro, Chicago, by 1968 [Chicago 1968]; given to the Art Institute, 1996.
copyright_notice: © 2018 Estate of Pablo Picasso / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York

input: Double Flute Player and Reclining Nude
